the native API for most messaging systems out there today there's also NMS which is for those
those dotnet apps out there it's a dotnet variant of of JMS and then there's a kind of kid on the block you
might have heard of called AMQP which is the advanced Message Queuing protocol it was recently ratified as an iso standard
and it actually is a wire level protocol that provides compatibility between
messaging systems at the wire so it's gaining popularity we're seeing a lot of interest in AMQP and it also

well as stomp a text protocol and WebSockets so it's got a lot of protocols and api's that are fairly

many of you are running mission critical systems on on these messaging systems so
we really looked at how are we going to architect this for high availability and high durability so we built Amazon mq to
automatically provision the broker for high availability and durability so we
have an active standby model as you see in the slide there across availability
zones as you know availability zones are geographically separate zones so in the case of an issue with a broker or even a
full availability zone outage the standby takes over there's no message loss messages are stored in a replicated
message store it's very highly durable and it's replicated across availability zones so if there is any kind of failure
issue with the broker with the or even the availability zone the standby takes over and there's no message loss so
that's those are you know that's for production instances and like RDS does we also offer single instances which are
just a single instance in a single lazy and that's really more useful for development and test scenarios when
you're not in production you don't need that active standby but you just want to try it out or evaluate or maybe you just want to do some testing so that's that's
also available you guys also told us that it has to be secure you want you
wanted we heard worryfree security so we designed it for the security enterprises need your data is encrypted both in
transit at rest it's encrypted in transit using using TLS you can also
choose to have your data persisted to an encrypted message store so the message store if you persist through the message
store accid mq has both the non persisted and persisted mode but if you if you persist that data
we'll be stored to an encrypted data store it's fully integrated as well with
Amazon V PC so you have V PC endpoints to the broker
by default of course you can also have a public endpoint if that's something you want to do but it's optional you can
just have it available only with in your view PC and that's actually the default mode and then security groups provide

port perspective when we talk to you

with Amazon CloudWatch metrics so you can monitor the health of your broker you can monitor things like CPU memory
